column4: Any debian packages of the interactive fiction terp Gargoyle?
I'd really like to see that make the Ubuntu repositories sometime
So I can play the games in the annual interactive fiction competitions
Yeah, there is because Linux Mint installs one
yeah, I know there is realplayer for linux, I just wondered if there is an official package
what is that? I have multiverse and universe enabled
most things work better in linux than vista :)
Well, maybe not my Nvidia Geforce Go display adapter, but everything else
really? I've had no problems on the dell  laptop I tried on - can't remember which go it was though (about a year old)
I tried to set up Beryl but Ubuntu Edgy's got an old version of the adapter that messes things up
so your card isnt fully supported in the edgy driver?

yeah, kernel driver issues. its a right PITA to fix it. I managed it by going back to the nv driver, then rebooting using an old kernel, uninstalling all the nvidia-glx packages and the linux-restricted-modules-common/k7 packages, then apt-get clean, then reinstalling them all
well, it worked using the latest repository driver
but if your card doesnt work with that driver I guess you'd need to manually install the latest nvidia driver

the GDM issue you had is almost certainly due to the driver not having the right kernel module available, or that it wasnt built at boot (check /etc/default/linux-restricted-modules to make sure that there isnt a line with "nv" in it)
